name: "G", why not take this Bible quiz? | Religion | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the son of Ebed?
questions.explanation:
Gaal.

	Gaal questioned the authority of Abimelech as to why he should serve him (Judges 9:29 KJV). He ultimately was kicked out of Shechem (Judges 9:41 KJV).

questions.text: What word means "the pavement" in Hebrew according to John 19:13 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Gabbatha.

	This is where Pontius Pilate brought Jesus. This was the judgement seat where Jesus stood for his sentencing.

Gadi.

	2 Kings 14 says, "For Menahem the son of Gadi went up from Tirzah, and came to Samaria, and smote Shallum the son of Jabesh in Samaria, and slew him, and reigned in his stead." You can read about this in 2 Kings 15. Gadi was one of the kings of Israel.

questions.text: In Ezekiel 22:30 (KJV) what did he send a man to stand in?
questions.explanation:
gap.

	Ezekiel 22:30 says, "And I sought for a man among them, that should make up the hedge, and stand in the gap before me for the land, that I should not destroy it: but I found none." This reflects to there not being one godly man in the city.

questions.text: According to Acts 14:13 (KJV) what g-word did the priest of Jupiter bring to the gates?
questions.explanation:
garland.

	The priest of Jupiter was a demon of some sort. His name in Greek was the priest of Zeus, but they were not the same demon.

questions.text: Where did the Philistines bring Samson?
questions.explanation:
Gaza.

	You can read about Samson in the book of Judges chapter 16. Judges 16:21 (KJV) says, "But the Philistines took him, and put out his eyes, and brought him down to Gaza, and bound him with fetters of brass; and he did grind in the prison house." Samson lost his strength when his hair was cut off making it easy for the Philistines to catch him. But later on Samson got his strength back and pushed down the pillars killing himself and all the Philistines in the building.

Gehazi.

	Gehazi is mentioned several times in 2 Kings 4. Gehazi was later stricken by Elisha with leprosy because he was guilty of " duplicity and dishonest conduct" You can read about that in 2 Kings 5.

questions.text: Which one of those g-men was Levi's son?
questions.explanation:
Gershon.

	His brothers were Kohath and Merari. Gershon was the oldest of the three. Gershon means "a sojourner there".

questions.text: Who in the Bible is associated with dew?
questions.explanation:
Gideon.

	Gideon's story can be found in Judges 6. Gideon was to command an army but didn't quite believe it so he asked for a piece of fleece to have dew on it but the ground dry. When that happened he still didn't believe so he asked for the ground to have dew on it but the fleece to be dry.

questions.text: What does Psalm 56:9 (KJV) say  all nations will do to the Lord's name?
questions.explanation:
glorify.

	Many Christians believe one of the reasons they are on Earth is to glorify the Lord. To glorify means to reveal the honor of God through our actions.
